Rmarkdown file to test envDocument::env_doc().

**Note** - if you render this document using `rmarkdown::render()` from a directory other than the one where this file is located you may encounter issues with determining the script path.  
This can be addressed by specifiying a root directory in the `setup` chunk or as an argument to `render()`:

```
# example: render this document starting from the top-level project directory
rmarkdown::render("./envDocument/tests/test_envDocument.Rmd", envir = new.env(), knit_root_dir = here::here())
```

```{r setup}
library(envDocument) # build & reload doesn't automatically knit .rmd files
library(knitr)

# opts_knit$set(root.dir = "../..") # alternative way to set root directory using knitr::opts_knit()

```

Calling `env_doc` without an output will return a single data frame that can be printed using `knitr::kable` or other output formatting utilities.  

```{r get_df}
info <- env_doc()

kable(env_doc()) # with git2r installed

# kable(env_doc(git = FALSE)) # without git2r
```

New option in v2.2: option "table" pretty-prints each section separately.
Requires `knitr`.  Specify `results = "asis"` in knitr chunk options to make sure
table is formatted in markdown (no leading ##).

```{r table, results = "asis"}
env_doc("table")

```

End of test
